Email Marketer Job at Quick Collect




        
    

        
        Quick Collect is a leading fintech company specializing in mobile money transfer solutions. Our user-friendly mobile app, available on both the Apple Store and Android, enables seamless money transfers to Nigeria, Ghana, and other African and European countries. We are dedicated to providing our customers with fast, secure, and efficient services to meet their financial needs. We are currently seeking a talented and creative Motion Graphic and Video Editor to join our team and enhance our visual storytelling.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Email Marketer

Job Locations: Abuja (FCT) , Akwa Ibom , Anambra, Enugu, Ondo, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Job Summary


	We are looking for a results-driven Email Marketer to plan, execute, and optimize email campaigns that drive engagement, retention, and conversions across Quick Collect’s products.


Responsibilities


	Plan and execute email campaigns and automations
	Create newsletters, onboarding, and promotional emails
	Use tools such as Mailchimp, Brevo (Sendinblue), or similar platforms
	Segment email lists and manage deliverability
	Track performance, run A/B tests, and optimize results
	Collaborate with product and growth teams


Qualifications


	2 – 4 years experience in email or digital marketing
	Strong knowledge of email marketing metrics and automation
	Hands-on experience with Brevo, Mailchimp or similar tools
	Excellent copywriting and communication skills
	Detail-oriented and data-driven.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@quickcollects.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Application Notice


	While applications are under review, candidates are encouraged to engage with Quick Collect’s YouTube and other social media channels to better understand our brand and communication style.
	Demonstrating genuine interest and initiative may provide an added advantage.

Inventory Control Analyst II Job at Nautilus Nigeria Engineering and Construction Limited




        
    

        
        Nautilus Nigeria Engineering and Construction Limited (NNEC)'s mission is to provide all clients with high quality, cost-effective, on-schedule engineering, project management, inspection and environmental services. NNEC is committed to design and build more efficient, safer, reliable, and environmentally friendly facilities for the betterment of our clients and their communities.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Control Analyst II

Job Location: Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-time

Main Functions
     

            
    




	Schedules and revises shipment plans to ensure efficient distribution of products to satisfy customers.
	Analyzes inventory levels, production speed and product demand to determine reorder levels which will ensure product availability and minimize inventory costs.
	Familiar with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within a particular field. Duties may include writing inventory reports, performing cycle counts, and determining periodic asset valuations.
	Works with moderate work direction and is skilled and knowledgeable to the position.
	Senior Inventory Control Analyst might be performing basic inventory decisions and analysis of high complexity.


Skills and Qualifications


	MS Excel, ERP experience, organized.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: infonnec1@nnecltd.com%C2%A0 using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "HR Business Partner Officer",
  "description": "At Mishra, we value individuals who deliver with Passion, Purpose and Performance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Business Partner Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Surulere,&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time&nbsp;(Hybrid)
Availability:&nbsp;Immediate Resumption

About the Role


	Are you a results-driven HR professional who thrives in a fast-paced environment? We are looking for an&nbsp;HR Business Partner Officer&nbsp;to lead our recruitment and HR operations for our diverse client base.
	This role is perfect for a self-starter who excels at sourcing low-to-mid-level talent and managing the full employee lifecycle with minimal supervision.


Core Responsibilities


	Mass Recruitment &amp; Outsourcing:&nbsp;Lead the end-to-end recruitment for roles such as Receptionists, Waiters, Bar-staff, Cleaners, and POS Agents.
	Compliance &amp; Verification:&nbsp;Manage comprehensive background checks and maintain flawless HR documentation for all outsourced staff.
	Performance Management:&nbsp;Conduct regular appraisals and provide recommendations for staff retention, promotion, or termination.
	HR Administration:&nbsp;Coordinate leave requests (annual/sick), payroll data inputs, and general HR administrative tasks on behalf of business partners.
	Strategic Advisory:&nbsp;Act as the primary point of contact for clients, offering &quot;hire and fire&quot; recommendations based on performance data and labor law compliance.


Requirements &amp; Qualifications


	Education:&nbsp;BSc / HND in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. Professional certificationis an added advantage.
	Experience:&nbsp;At least&nbsp;3 years&nbsp;of experience in HR, specifically within recruitment agencies or outsourcing firms.
	Technical Skill:&nbsp;Proven ability to source and vet blue-collar and mid-level service staff quickly.
	Independence:&nbsp;Must be able to work autonomously and manage a high volume of tasks without constant oversight.
	Location:&nbsp;Residents of&nbsp;Surulere&nbsp;or very close proximity (Yaba, Costain, Ojuelegba) will be given strong preference.


Working Pattern:


	Hybrid:&nbsp;3 days onsite in Surulere, 2 days remote.
	Must be available for&nbsp;immediate resumption.


Why Join Us?


	Salary:&nbsp;N150,000 &ndash; N200,000 Monthly (Based on experience)
	Opportunity to work with a diverse portfolio of business clients.
	Autonomy to lead HR processes and drive impact.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter highlighting their experience in high-volume recruitment to:&nbsp;applywithmishra@gmail.com&nbsp;using &quot;HRBP Officer - Surulere&quot; as the subject of the mail.",

HR Business Partner Officer Job at Mishra Global Resources




        
    

        
        At Mishra, we value individuals who deliver with Passion, Purpose and Performance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Business Partner Officer

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Hybrid)
Availability: Immediate Resumption

About the Role
     

            
    




	Are you a results-driven HR professional who thrives in a fast-paced environment? We are looking for an HR Business Partner Officer to lead our recruitment and HR operations for our diverse client base.
	This role is perfect for a self-starter who excels at sourcing low-to-mid-level talent and managing the full employee lifecycle with minimal supervision.


Core Responsibilities


	Mass Recruitment & Outsourcing: Lead the end-to-end recruitment for roles such as Receptionists, Waiters, Bar-staff, Cleaners, and POS Agents.
	Compliance & Verification: Manage comprehensive background checks and maintain flawless HR documentation for all outsourced staff.
	Performance Management: Conduct regular appraisals and provide recommendations for staff retention, promotion, or termination.
	HR Administration: Coordinate leave requests (annual/sick), payroll data inputs, and general HR administrative tasks on behalf of business partners.
	Strategic Advisory: Act as the primary point of contact for clients, offering "hire and fire" recommendations based on performance data and labor law compliance.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Education: BSc / HND in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. Professional certificationis an added advantage.
	Experience: At least 3 years of experience in HR, specifically within recruitment agencies or outsourcing firms.
	Technical Skill: Proven ability to source and vet blue-collar and mid-level service staff quickly.
	Independence: Must be able to work autonomously and manage a high volume of tasks without constant oversight.
	Location: Residents of Surulere or very close proximity (Yaba, Costain, Ojuelegba) will be given strong preference.


Working Pattern:


	Hybrid: 3 days onsite in Surulere, 2 days remote.
	Must be available for immediate resumption.


Why Join Us?


	Salary: N150,000 – N200,000 Monthly (Based on experience)
	Opportunity to work with a diverse portfolio of business clients.
	Autonomy to lead HR processes and drive impact.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter highlighting their experience in high-volume recruitment to: applywithmishra@gmail.com using "HRBP Officer - Surulere" as the subject of the mail.
